title: Wallet balance is empty from Turkey (works with Estonia VPN) [http: server gave HTTP response to HTTPS client]

milestone.description:
General:
- Memory Usage Improvements (part 3)

General:
- Account Syncing

body:
# Bug Report ## Description When I start Status app and open wallet, the balance is not loaded. There's a bunch of `http: server gave HTTP response to HTTPS client` errors in log. And there's also no UI alert/reaction to this üôÅ Same as for https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/8597
Log errors 

DBG 2022-12-05 11:12:01.909+03:00 NewBE_callPrivateRPC                       topics="rpc" tid=10201049 file=core.nim:20 rpc_method=wallet_fetchPrices
ERR 2022-12-05 11:12:02.107+03:00 rpc response error                         topics="rpc" tid=10201049 file=core.nim:29 err="\nstatus-go error [methodName:wallet_fetchPrices, code:-32000, message:Get \"https://min-api.cryptocompare.com/data/pricemulti?fsyms=ETH&tsyms=usd&extraParams=Status.im\": http: server gave HTTP response to HTTPS client ]\n"

After restarting the app with Estonia VPN connected the balances are loaded with no problem: ## Steps to reproduce #### Expected behavior #### Actual behavior ### Additional Information - Status desktop version: - Operating System:
@igor-sirotin could u verify that u have no problem connecting to infura API?
@igor-sirotin i doubt we have it related to the app itself. Please check it with Infura api as @alaibe suggested

@anastasiyaig, sorry I didn't reply here. I discussed that in dm with @alaibe. 

He helped me to figure out that the problem was actually about my internet provider settings. There was some default 
_Family secure_ settings, which was blocking access to [cryptocompare.com](https://cryptocompare.com/). I was able and already fixed that on my side.

Though there's still another problem: the UI didn't respond about the problem in any way. I just see zero balances and that's it üôÅ 

There is an issue about this already. Probable this could be closed then?
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/8597
happy to close this one then :) Glad u got it sorted!
